newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel tests Arrow anti-missile missile.
newsitem.headline: Israel tests Arrow anti-missile missile.

text.p: Israel successfully test launched its Arrow anti-missile missile on Tuesday, Israel radio said.
"Israel has made another test of the Arrow anti-missile missile," the radio said. "According to initial reports the test was a complete success."
A spokeswoman for Israel Aircraft Industries confirmed the test launch. She said the missile hit its target.
"According to initial results, all systems including the radar worked correctly. The test was successful and now is being analysed," she told Reuters.
The Arrow was last tested in August 1996.
Development of the Arrow is jointly financed by the United States and Israel. Security sources estimate the two countries have poured $500 million into the project since 1991.
